snippet: The head of France’s National Front party refused on Tuesday to endorse either remaining candidate, and instead urged her supporters to “vote according to your conscience.”
abstract: Marine Le Pen, leader of France's far-right National Front party, refuses to endorse either Nicolas Sarkozy or Francois Hollande in the country's contentious runoff election; National Front garnered about 18 percent of the electorate in the first round of the election, and their 6.4 million votes could prove decisive in the runoff. Photos (M)2

byline.original: By NICOLA CLARK; Eleanor Stanford, Meghan Davidson and Roswana Khan contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: PARIS -- With just five days before the runoff that will decide France's presidential race, the leader of the far-right National Front party refused on Tuesday to endorse either remaining candidate, and instead urged her supporters to ''vote according to your conscience.'' About 6.4 million voters, or 18 percent of the total, backed the nationalist leader, Marine Le Pen, in the first round on April 22, the best showing in the party's history, and their votes may prove decisive in the runoff between the incumbent, Nicolas Sarkozy, and his Socialist challenger, François Hollande.

headline.main: French Far-Right Leader Endorses No One in Runoff
